recipe_name: Grilled sesame prawns with red pepper and garlic dressing
author: Richard Phillips
method: For the red pepper and garlic dressing, heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium and fry the onion and garlic for 4-5 minutes, until soft but not coloured. Add the red pepper and stir well, then pour in the wine and add the salt. Boil for 5-7 minutes, until the dressing is beginning to reduce and the red pepper is tender. For the prawns, roll the prawns in the sesame seeds to completely coat. Heat a griddle pan and drizzle with the oil. Add the prawns and cook for two minutes on each side, until completely cooked through . To serve, spoon the red pepper and garlic dressing onto a plate and place the sesame prawns on top.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  1 garlic clove, chopped,  1 red pepper, chopped,  100ml/3½fl oz white wine,  ½ tsp sea salt,  2 king prawns, shells removed, de-veined,  1 tbsp sesame seeds,  1 tbsp olive oil
